I am commiting now to obtaining a degree in mechanical engineering within 5 years. I am doing this because I want to get a job working in a cutting edge space industry organization. I want to do this because I think space is cool and I want to challenge myself in a way that keeps my attention.
To accomplish these goals I will be first attending a 2 year college to keep my costs down, and completing projects throughout. While attending college I will work on specific engineering projects related to the job I want and documenting my progress here. The projects I hope to build include:
A Thermal Vaccum Chamber A Reaction Wheel Attitude Control Demonstration A Robotic Arm A Cube Sat Payload An Asteroid Mining Simulation Simulate Asteroid Surface Operations In addition to the projects I will also involve myself in organizations that can help me achieve my goals such as a Robotics Club, AIAA, RockSat, and CanSat.
I will try to find research to perform for at least 1 semester. and I will try to get internships at NASA, JPL, and/ or APL.
Skill I will master include Python, C/C++, ROS2, Cotrol Systems, CAD, FEA, GD+T, Thermal Modeling.
summary: A summary of my goals over the next 5 years
title: 5 Year Goal Summary

summary:
Purpose

This page is a minimal working demonstration of a browser-based economic model for asteroid mining as an input to space-based solar panel production.

At this stage, the model is intentionally simple.

Layer One: Asteroid Resource Model

This layer estimates the cost per kilogram of usable material delivered to cislunar space from a single asteroid mining mission.

Key Assumptions

  • Asteroid mass: 500,000 metric tons
  • Accessible fraction: 20%
  • Useful material fraction: 30%
  • Extraction efficiency: 70%
  • Baseline mission cost: $5 billion
  • Delta-v (round trip): 6 km/s

These values are deliberately conservative and intended to establish order-of-magnitude feasibility.
title: Asteroid Mining Economics: A Minimal Model
